name: Shipwright Quarter
culture_adjustments: guild-dominated apprenticeship rites and secret hand-signs
launch-day hull-blessing ceremonies more elaborate than elsewhere
practical superstition (wind/shoal rites) prioritized over broad festivals
strong patron-client networks centered on ship contracts
long night work-shifts for careening and repairs
constraints: guild charters restrict external labor and methods
ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents
combustion-driven industry legally and practically limited
notes: primary source of state ship tonnage
hosts official launch rituals and resident augurers
technical knowledge guarded in guild libraries
